content: Click on the drop down arrow to the right of the attachment notification at the bottom of the email. Select 'Save As' (or just click on the 'Save' command). Navigate to where you want the attachment saved (create your own folder on your Desktop or hard drive) and save it there. TB will open in the same place each time until you change the location.
creator: frisée

content: Many thanks for responding to my inquiry. I understand that ThB will keep the folder where I saved a file previously. Is there any function that ThB will automatically open the folder where I saved an attachment file just after I have saved it?
creator: cycle.bito2

content:
> Is there any function that ThB will automatically open the folder where I saved an attachment file just after I have saved it?

No. But ctrl+J opens the download manager. From there you can jump to the folder where attachments were saved.
creator: wsmwk

content:
cycle.bito2 said
Is there any function that ThB will automatically open the folder where I saved an attachment file just after I have saved it?

Not that I'm aware but why would you need that functionality? You simply tell TB to launch the attachment to view it.

content:
lee-polly said
When I send an email, the receiver just sees my email address.

It seems that you're saying that the receiving person only sees your email address in their software? If that's the case, the recipient needs to deal with the issue.

Are you saying that the 'Recipient' or 'From' column in TB's list of emails is not displaying how you want it to and only showing an email address? Each address book entry has a 'Display As' field that can be used to have the email display as you wish in both 'Recipient' and 'From' columns

content: Are you able to go into the Profile folder to see what size the folders are of all the Archived? They should be located, I think, at C:\Users\[User Name]\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\XXXX.default-release\IMAP Mail\Local Folders\Archives\ There should be two files for '2024'. What sizes are they?

content:
In de kennisbank van MozillaZine vond ik dit artikel, maar daarin staat deze specifieke switch niet benoemd.

Wat verder spitwerk suggereert dat ‘reply-to’ als switch kan worden gebruikt, zoals in dit voorbeeld:

thunderbird -compose "to=ontvanger@example.com,subject=Uw onderwerp,body=Uw bericht,reply-to=AntwoordAan@example.com"

Hopelijk werkt dit!

creator: wsmwk

content:
Installed through apt (not snap).

But I could "solve" it:

  1. Uninstall thunderbird
  2. Install thunderbird through snap
  3. Ran into error that thunderbird process is already running (but there is none). This is a known problem, because my thunderbird-profile was on an encrypted veracrypt container and snap cannot access non-home files
  4. moved thunderbird-profile to /home/.thunderbird/xyz
  5. reinstalled thunderbird through apt (removed snap version)

Thunderbird runs normally
creator: michaelkron

content:

content:
Assuming that you run a Windows-based operating system, that is a question about the Operating System and not a problem with Thunderbird operating correctly.

You would need to, firstly, attach a mouse (usually via a USB port). The touch pad could be disabled but it would be better to leave it as a back up in case the mouse fails.
creator: frisée

content:
Buffering is the way streaming video works, although the phrase is now used to refer to when there is a delay in the video and you get those annoying round animations when the stream stops for a while.

Do you mean that TB seems to stop working? If so, what is it doing when it stops working? Are there any error messages that you can post a screenshot of? Is it just TB that stops or is the computer frozen as well?

Please provide additional information.

creator: admin932

content:
Please start your computer in 'Safe Mode with Networking' and see if the problem persists. This will not solve the problem but it will help diagnose it.

A lot of these are conflicts with other software or the Operating System itself which constantly change.

What happened during the last boot up prior to this starting? And in the current session when it started? Were there any other incidents or events?

content:
Thank you both, frisée's reply lead to some poking around in my profile's prefs.js where I indeed had an address book which I had overlooked. I couldn't remove it from the front end for reasons unknown, but a manual edit of prefs.js and deletion of the related abook* files did the trick.

Thanks again!

content:
Open Message in Conversation depends on the Global Search database. Try rebuilding the database and see if it improves.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database
creator: sfhowes

content:
Possible workaround:

  1. Numbered list item I made a new local folder.
  2. The problematic messages could be moved into the new folder.
  3. All the email from the old folder could be moved into the new folder.
  4. The old damaged folder (now empty) was deleted.
  5. The new folder was renamed.

This has happened to me now twice...

I have my local folders in a OneDrive folder so maybe that is causing trouble? BTW, our default OneDrive configuration keeps versions forever so all my local folders and nearly every version gets backed up. 10 GB of mail went to 4 TB, lol.
creator: SpecialEd1234

content:
SpEd said
... and then choose Compact Folders...I do not want to zip my local folders.

Compacting the folders does not zip the files - it removes blank space from the data files and is a necessary maintenance function of TB.

I think your second post says that the problem is resolved?

content:
douchin.regis said
But how can yu explain I can see deletes folders in TB's trash but any file inside ?

I don't follow what you're saying.

I think you mean to ask me how you can see a header but not a body. IMAP (which you have not clarified if you're using) can have headers only downloaded and you decide which bodies to download once you see the headers.

I was surprised that TB could even download the headers if they don't exist in Orange but I was hopeful that you might be able to download the bodies if you had the command line to do so.
creator: frisée

content: J'ai été surpris comme vous que TB puisse télécharger des dossiers effacés dans ma messagerie Orange mais je ne vois pas avec quelle ligne de commande il me serait possible de télécharger les fichiers (mails) qui n'apparaissent pas dans la corbeille de TB...
creator: douchin.regis

content:
douchin.regis said
I was surprised like you that TB could download deleted folders in my Orange mailbox but I don't see with which command line it would be possible for me to download the files (mails) which do not appear in the TB trash...

I am only treading water here until someone else looks and answers it.

I don't run an IMAP account (you still haven't told me if you have an IMAP set up) so I can't duplicate what I'm asking you to do but I suggested that you right-click on a header that lacks a body to see if you get a command to download the body.

You could also try Ctrl+O after highlighting a header. Or look under the Menu options at the top of the program for a command similar to the one I specified.

Please make sure that you reply once you've tried these options so that your request goes back into the list of questions yet to be dealt with.

content:
Okay, nothing there.

Something to try - make a folder in the server directory of the Orange Account (NOT 'Local Folers') and COPY *not move* all the headers into it.

Under Account Settings/Server Settings (of the Orange Account) find where it says something like 'Automatically download new messages' and make sure it's ticked. See my attachment.

Close TB and reload.

Hoping that TB might kick in and download the headers.

Please reply if this doesn't work so your email goes back on the pile of questions still to be answered. The US should be starting to wake up and there are more advisors that come on from now...

content: Open an email reply window NOT the main interface. Then View/Toolbars in that window. btw, the Ctrl+Enter command saves switching from keyboard to mouse and back to keyboard and will save some wear and tear on your fingers. Désinstaller une application fait partie des connaissances de base en informatique. Dans le cas de Thunderbird ça ne va pas changer grand-chose car la cause se trouve le plus souvent dans le profil de Thunderbird.

J'ai fait un transfert sur un autre pc en suivant les données sur ce sujet et cela fonctionne. Pourrais-je faire la même chose en sens inverse ?

Si on sais le faire correctement on peut bien sûr transférer le profil d'une installation Thunderbird sur un PC sur celle d'un autre.
